content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata>   <idinfo>     <citation>       <citeinfo>         <origin>USDA Risk Management Agency</origin>         <origin>PRISM Climate Group at Oregon State University</origin>         <pubdate>2014</pubdate>         <title>Parameter-Elevation Regressions on Independent Slopes Model (PRISM) Dataset</title>         <pubinfo>           <pubplace>Washington, DC</pubplace>           <publish>USDA Risk Management Agency</publish>         </pubinfo>         <onlink>http://prism.oregonstate.edu/</onlink>         <onlink>http://prism.oregonstate.edu/documents/PRISM_datasets_aug2013.pdf</onlink>       </citeinfo>     </citation>     <descript>       <abstract>The PRISM Climate Group gathers climate observations and then develops spatial climate datasets to reveal short- and long-term climate patterns. The vailable parameters include precipitation, temperature, dewpoint and vapor pressure and are available at multiple spatial/temporal resolutions, with some datasets going back to 1895.</abstract>       <purpose>The PRISM climate datasets datasets are used to evaluate long-term climate patterns and trends as well as short-term drought status and severity.  The datasets are also used by universities as well as various state and federal agencies and for research, planning and operational activities.</purpose>     </descript>     <timeperd>       <timeinfo>         <rngdates>           <begdate>1895</begdate>           <enddate>Present</enddate>         </rngdates>       </timeinfo>       <current>publication date</current>     </timeperd>
